## 1 - Road traffic accidents in Edinburgh

```{## 1 - Road Traffic Accidents in Edinburgh}

#| message: false
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(hms)

accidents <- read_csv("data/accidents.csv")

accidents <- accidents |>
  mutate(
    date = as.Date(date),
    time = as_hms(time),
    hour = hour(time) + minute(time) / 60,
    day_type = if_else(weekdays(date) %in% c("Saturday", "Sunday"), "Weekend", "Weekday"),
    severity = factor(severity, levels = c("Fatal", "Serious", "Slight"))
  )

#| message: false
ggplot(accidents, aes(x = hour, fill = severity)) +
  geom_density(alpha = 0.6) +
  facet_wrap(~day_type, ncol = 1) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("purple", "steelblue", "khaki")) +
  labs(
    title = "Number of Accidents Throughout the Day",
    subtitle = "By Day of Week and Severity",
    x = "Hour of Day",
    y = "Density",
    fill = "Severity"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14)

**Interpretation:**  
This density plot shows how traffic accidents in Edinburgh vary throughout the day. On weekdays, there are clear morning and evening peaks. On weekends, the peaks occur slightly later. Slight and serious accidents are most common, while fatal accidents are rare.

```
